response:
Urgent MRI is the gold standard to differentiate between compressive (abscess, tumour) and non-compressive (transverse myelitis, infarction) lesions. Blood tests and cultures are essential to define the infective or inflammatory nature of the consolidation seen on CXR.

investigations = ["MRI Whole Spine with contrast", "MRI Brain", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "C-reactive protein (CRP)", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)", "Blood cultures", "Sputum culture", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Vitamin B12 and folate", "Lumbar Puncture"]
